Key Match Events: Towhid Hridoy runs out Abhishek Sharma
Arshdeep Singh takes the final wicket as Team India bowl Bangladesh out for 127
Varun Chakravarthy having a day out as he takes his 3rd scalp
Bangladesh in deep trouble, slip to 75/6 as Washington Sundar gets his first wicket of the match
Mayank Yadav picks up his first wicket in international cricket
Varun Chakravarthy has struck to get the better of Towhid Hridoy
Arshdeep Singh is swinging through the Bangladeshi batters in Gwalior
Mayank Yadav, on debut, bowls a maiden in what is his first over
Arshdeep Singh strikes in the first over as captain Litton Das looks to play a big shot but mistimes and gets caught by Rinku Singh
Pre-Game Insights: Captain Suryakumar Yadav, who started his full-time stint as T20I captain with a 3-0 series win over Sri Lanka, has announced Abhishek Sharma and Sanju Samson as the new opening pair
Tearaway pacer Mayank Yadav is also likely to make his international debut
Post-Match Reflections: Hardik Pandya finishes things off with a six and India finish off the game with 49 balls to spare. They take a 1-0 series lead with two more T20Is to go.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India take a 1-0 series lead with two more T20Is to go
Bangladesh in deep trouble, slip to 75/6 as Washington Sundar gets his first wicket of the match
Others: The two-Test series against Bangladesh done and dusted and India winning it comprehensively, the two sides will shift their attention to the T20Is
Shakib Al Hasan announced his retirement from the format
Conditions in India encouraging batters as well as bowlers
